question: Which nation has the lease to use the "Moldauhafen Plot" located in Germany?
explanation: In 1929, Czechoslovakia acquired a 99-year lease, according to the Treaty of Versailles, to use the Moldauhafen Plot located in Hamburg Port of Germany to allow the nation a place where goods transported down river could be transferred to seagoing ships. Rivers from the Czech Republic flows to three different seas:- the North Sea, Baltic Sea and the Black Sea. The Czech Republic succeeded the rights of Czechoslovakia in 1993 and the lease will expire in 2028.
